column4: If I already have ubuntu and windows loaded I should take ubuntu off and put it back on?
Is there anyway I can back up all of my ubuntu settings and then reinstall it later and get it all back?
And I can just drag them all to a hard drive?
by restore do you mean I just replace the new one with the old one?
it giving me the error "The folder ".gnupg" cannot be handled because you do not have permissions to read it."
just skip it. you don't need it

well you should probably start with a hackintosh guide. i know lifehacker has a couple of good ones to set up a dual boot windows/os x system. after that, you'd just create another partition for linux and install ubuntu there
yes. you should be presented with a graphical boot loader which will list windows, os x, linux, and any other bootable media
the lifehacker guides should go into detail about that
back up your entire home folder. make sure to include hidden files (ctrl+h to show them)
yep, and restore them after reinstallation. make sure your new install uses the same username
exactly. so after you finish installing, you go to your backup, and replace your new /home folder with the backed up /home folder
you may also want to back up /etc/apt as well if you have added any custom repositories. otherwise, you'll have to re-add them
if i were you, i would look up one of those how-to's on lifehacker to see if you're willing to go through with it to begin with
